body_html:
Sorry for misunderstanding the depthwise convolution, I thought the term would just generally describe using different filters for different depths (and therefore include groups).
The exact reason to implement a function such as this is to avoid explicit slicing of the kernels, biases and inputs. An additional reason why I thought it might be useful is because Caffe had "groups" as a possible parameter in the convolution layer http://caffe.berkeleyvision.org/tutorial/layers.html. I thought it might be nice to have tensorflow support for this behavior.

body:
Sorry for misunderstanding the depthwise convolution, I thought the term would just generally describe using different filters for different depths (and therefore include groups).
The exact reason to implement a function such as this is to avoid explicit slicing of the kernels, biases and inputs. An additional reason why I thought it might be useful is because Caffe had "groups" as a possible parameter in the convolution layer [http://caffe.berkeleyvision.org/tutorial/layers.html](url). I thought it might be nice to have tensorflow support for this behavior.
